Georges Leclerc Collection of Revolutionary War Papers of French Commanders,

userestrict.head: Publication Rights/ Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Before publishing quotations or excerpts from any materials, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Librarian/ Associate Curator of Rare Books and Manuscripts, and the holder of the copyright, if not the Rockefeller Library at Colonial Williamsburg.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Georges LeClerc Collection of Revolutionary War Papers of French Commanders, Manuscript 31.17, John D. Rockefeller, Jr. Library, Colonial Williamsburg Foundation

altformavail.head: Alternative Form
altformavail.p: Also available on microfilm M-1551, in transcripion TR/71 (with translations), and as photocopies PH/16.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Letters (in French) of French commanders in the American Revolution. They include material on the French campaigns around Newport, R. I.; a map drawn for the siege of Yorktown, Va.; letters written from Williamsburg, Va., and Lebanon, Pa., regarding the conduct of the war; letters from Versailles to the governor of Tobago; and letters from Lafayette to M. Le Noir regarding negotiations for a treaty of commerce between France and the United States, 1786. There are also projected itineraries for the French army's march from Phillipsburg and White Plains to Philadelphia, and from Baltimore to Gloucester, Va. Among the signatures are those of de Bouill鬠de Castries, de Damas, de La Perouse, de Lauzun, de Vaudreuil, Rochambeau, and Viomenil.

controlaccess.head: Persons:
controlaccess.persname: Biron, Armand-Louis de Gontaut, duc de, 1747- 1793.
Castries, Armand-Charles-Augustin de La Croix, duc de, 1756- 1842.
Lafayette, Marie Joseph Paul Yves Roch Gilbert Du Motier, marquis de, 1757-1834.
Rochambeau, Jean-Baptiste-Donatien de Vimeur, comte de, 1725-1807.
Vaudreuil, Louis Philippe de Rigaud, marquis de, 1724-1802.
Viomenil, Antoine Charles du Houx, baron de, 1728- 1792.
